justification: The text notes that "studies sometimes treat achievement on the e.g. cognitive reflection test (Frederick, 2005) as a dispositional correlate ... of rational thinking," linking the construct to the CRT measure.
It describes "tasks for registering heuristics and biases (HB tasks)" that record the systematic errors (i.e., cognitive biases) people make, indicating these tasks measure that construct.
The passage refers to "metacognitive assessment, the feeling of rightness, FOR; Thompson, 2007; Thompson, 2009" showing FOR judgments are used to gauge this metacognitive construct.

"Stanovich and colleagues elaborated on the construct of the rationality quotient as an intellectual or cognitive ability different from intelligence"—implying the Rationality Quotient is an assessment of rational‐thinking ability.
